attributes.action: Ban all Christmas-themed advertisements, except during the month of December.
attributes.background: The 12 Days of Christmas has become the 60 days of Christmas. Christmas adverts now appear on TV, radio and in print, beginning in late-October. Why? No other festival requires such intensive marketing. The hype is eroding the 'magic' of Christmas, for religious and secular observers alike.

rejection.details:
The Government is not directly responsible for advertising. All forms of advertising in the UK are regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA) , who impose the British Advertising Codes. 

You can find out more about the ASA here:

https://www.asa.org.uk/
